acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=10.5microg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >10,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.1mg/L (4 hours) (EHC183 (1996)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >10,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 2B by IARC (1999) and Category 2B by the Japan Society for Occupational Health.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=125(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 252.1degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)), mouse in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)), and in vivo chromosome aberration tests performed in rats and hamsters (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1995)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not fluorine and oxygen), with the fluorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of increased early embryonic mortality at doses causing reduced parental body weight gains observed in rat teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of moderate irritation which persisted for up to day 7, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: The available rabbit skin irritation tests demonstrated mild reversible irritation: mild erythema observed in all treated animals receiving 24 hour application (though the effects cleared up after 2-7 days) and mild to moderate edema in most animals exposed to >2.15g/kg (though the effects resolved after 1-2 days) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)). However, given the high doses of application (1.0g/rabbit at a minimum) and long exposure duration (24 hours), it is decided not to use these findings for classification.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in skin sensitization tests with chlorothalonil (neat) in Hartley guinea pigs, though skin photosensitivity tests in guinea pigs using the Herber method showed negative.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat acute toxicity studies, proventricular changes probably due to irritation was observed at doses within the guidance value ranges for Category 1. However, no other findings referable to specific target organs were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)) and insufficient data are available.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Insufficient data available: the different routes of exposure resulted in substantial differences in the degree of toxicity (the dermal LD50 was >=10,000mg/kg without any noted symptoms of toxicity, whereas the inhalation LC50 was 0.1mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1973)).
